Class SQLCalls

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLCalls
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CashierCalls

    public class SQLCalls
extends java.lang.Object
    The SQLCalls class provides methods for interacting with the POS system's database. This class encapsulates database operations and SQL queries, allowing the application to communicate with the underlying database. It includes methods for executing queries, retrieving data, and managing database connections. Note: This class assumes a specific database schema and connection details.
    Since:
    Oct 3, 2023

      • getColumnNames

        public java.lang.String[] getColumnNames(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                         java.lang.String table)
        Retrieves the column names of a specified SQL table. This method executes a SQL query to retrieve the column names of a specified database table. It returns an array of strings containing the column names.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        table - The name of the SQL table for which column names are to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        An array of strings representing the column names of the specified table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

                                                  java.lang.String table,

        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        table - The name of the SQL table from which to retrieve values.
        columnName - The name of the column from which to retrieve values.
        Returns:
        An array of strings containing the values from the specified column.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

      • getOneTableValue

        public java.lang.String getOneTableValue(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                         java.lang.String table,
                                         java.lang.String columnName,
                                         java.lang.String conditionColumn,
                                         java.lang.String conditionValue)
        Retrieves a single value from a specific column of a SQL table based on a condition. This method executes a SQL query to retrieve a value from a specific column of a given database table based on a specified condition. It returns the selected value as a string.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        table - The name of the SQL table from which to retrieve the value.
        columnName - The name of the column from which to retrieve the value.
        conditionColumn - The name of the column to use for the condition.
        conditionValue - The value to match in the condition.
        Returns:
        The selected value from the specified column that matches the condition.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        table - The name of the SQL table from which to retrieve the values.

      • ordersInRange

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ordersInRange(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                                           java.lang.String time1,
                                                           java.lang.String time2)
        Retrieves a list of order IDs within a specified date range. This method executes an SQL query to retrieve a list of order IDs from a database table where the order date falls within the specified date range. The result is returned as an ArrayList of strings.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        time1 - The start date of the date range (formatted as a string, e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DD').
        time2 - The end date of the date range (formatted as a string, e.g., 'YYYY-MM-DD').
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of strings containing order IDs within the specified date range.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

      • ViewTable

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> ViewTable(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                                                            java.lang.String[] columnNames,
                                                                            java.lang.String table)
        View the contents of a database table and format the results. This method executes an SQL query to retrieve all rows and columns from a specified database table. The result is formatted and returned as an ArrayList of ArrayLists of strings, where each inner ArrayList represents a row of data.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        columnNames - An array of column names for the table, used for formatting the results.
        table - The name of the database table to view.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of ArrayLists of strings containing the formatted table data.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

      • AddItem

        public static void AddItem(java.lang.String table,
                           java.sql.Statement stmt,
                           java.lang.Object[] values)
        Add an item to a specified database table. This method inserts a new row into a specified database table with the provided values.
        Parameters:
        table - The name of the database table where the item will be added.
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        values - An array of objects representing the values to be added to the table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

      • UpdateTable

        public static void UpdateTable(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                               java.lang.Object value,
                               java.lang.String table,
                               java.lang.String changedValueColumn,
                               java.lang.String sameValueColumn,
                               java.lang.String sameValue)
        Update a database table with a new value provided for a specific column based on a condition. This method updates a database table by setting a new value for a specified column based on a condition where another column has a particular value.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        value - The new value to set in the specified column.
        table - The name of the database table to be updated.
        changedValueColumn - The name of the column to be updated with the new value.
        sameValueColumn - The name of the column that needs to match a specific value.
        sameValue - The value that the "sameValueColumn" should match for the condition.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

      • deleteItem

        public static void deleteItem(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                              java.lang.String table,
                              java.lang.String column,
                              java.lang.String value)
        Delete a row of data from a database table based on a specified condition. This method deletes a row of data from a database table where a specified column matches a given value.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        table - The name of the database table from which to delete the row.
        column - The name of the column that should match the specified value for the deletion condition.
        value - The value that the specified column should match to delete the row.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

      • checkIfValueExists

        public java.lang.String checkIfValueExists(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                           java.lang.String table,
                                           java.lang.String returnedColumnName,
                                           java.lang.String conditionColumnName,
                                           java.lang.String condition)
        Check if a specified value exists in a database table based on a given condition. This method checks if a value exists in a database table by evaluating a condition on a specified column.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        table - The name of the database table to perform the existence check.
        returnedColumnName - The name of the column whose value is returned as "TRUE" if the condition is met, or "FALSE" if it is not.
        conditionColumnName - The name of the column on which the condition is evaluated.
        condition - The condition to be evaluated for existence (e.g., "column_name = value").
        Returns:
        "TRUE" if the specified condition exists in the table, "FALSE" otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

      • getQuantityOfIngredientsInMenuItem

        public java.lang.String getQuantityOfIngredientsInMenuItem(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                                           java.lang.String ingredient_id,
                                                           java.lang.String menu_item_id)
        Get the quantity of an ingredient in a menu item based on specific conditions. This method retrieves the quantity of an ingredient in a menu item from a database table by evaluating two conditions: ingredient_id and menu_item_id.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        ingredient_id - The unique identifier of the ingredient.
        menu_item_id - The unique identifier of the menu item.
        Returns:
        The quantity of the specified ingredient in the specified menu item.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.

      • getSalesByMenuItem

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSalesByMenuItem(java.sql.Statement stmt,
                                                                java.lang.String startTime,
                                                                java.lang.String endTime)
        Retrieve a list of menu items sold within a specified time range. This method retrieves the names of menu items that were sold in orders placed within the specified time range.
        Parameters:
        stmt - A Statement object for executing SQL queries.
        startTime - The start time of the time range (in a format compatible with the database).
        endTime - The end time of the time range (in a format compatible with the database).
        Returns:
        A list of menu item names sold during the specified time range.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if an error occurs while executing the SQL query.
